etymology.description: 丿(丿) (piě, "slash") + 一(一) (yī, "one") = forming a path -> step
etymology.interpretation: The character 亍 represents a form of walking or stepping through its simplistic depiction of a path or trail. Consisting of an introductory stroke 丿(丿) (piě, "slash") followed by 一(一) (yī, "one"), it suggests the concept of a basic step or movement.

examples.chinese: 每走一亍(每走一亍)，都是前进的一步(都是前進的一步)。
examples.pinyin: Měi zǒu yī chù, dōu shì qiánjìn de yībù.
examples.english: Every step is a step forward.

examples.chinese: 他细细品味着生活的每一亍(他細細品味著生活的每一亍)，步步向前(步步向前)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xìxì pǐnwèi zhe shēnghuó de měi yī chù, bù bù xiàng qián.
examples.english: He savors every step of life and steadily moves forward.
